title: Teen injured after shots fly on Interstate 70 in St. Louis
content:
ST. LOUIS • Four teenagers told police someone fired shots at their car on Interstate 70 late Saturday night.
One of the victims, 17, was hit in the shoulder. He was taken to a hospital, where police say he was stable. Police had no medical condition for the injured teen.
Three others in the car, also 17-year-old males, were not injured.
They told police someone shot their vehicle while they were driving on westbound I-70 near North Broadway at about 11:20 p.m. Saturday. They flagged down a police officer near West Florissant and Pope avenues.
Police had no suspects in the case.
